episodes.title: In His Image
episodes.plot: A young man grapples with an urge to kill and confusion about his origins.

episodes.title: The Thirty-Fathom Grave
episodes.plot: As a U.S. Navy destroyer cruises near Guadalcanal in the South Pacific, its sonar detects muted but constant hammering on metal undersea. The eerie sounds emanate from a submarine on the ocean floor, apparently there since World War II. The ship's chief boatswain's mate becomes very nervous, having served aboard that sub - and he was its sole survivor.

episodes.title: Valley of the Shadow
episodes.plot: A reporter stumbles into a peaceful town where miracles seem to occur due to technology and the townsfolk won't let him leave.

episodes.title: He's Alive
episodes.plot: A tiny neo-Nazi organization struggles pathetically to succeed in a big city. A mysterious figure begins to ruthlessly guide a young, insecure U.S. Nazi leader, and the group begins to draw more attention.

episodes.title: Mute
episodes.plot: The orphaned daughter of telepathic parents must learn to speak and deal with a world she cannot communicate in.

episodes.title: Death Ship
episodes.plot: An interplanetary expedition from Earth finds an exact duplicate of their ship and themselves crashed on the planet they were surveying. Should they stay or risk taking off and crashing?

episodes.title: Jess-Belle
episodes.plot: Appalachian beauty Jess-Belle can't bear to lose the object of her passion to the local rich girl, so she turns to the local witch for aid. The results bring unexpected and tragic consequences.

episodes.title: Miniature
episodes.plot: Mousey misfit Charley Parkes finds the world unfolding before him in a museum doll house to be more real than his boring job and overbearing mother.

episodes.title: Printer's Devil
episodes.plot: A man sells his soul to the Devil to save his failing newspaper and gets more than he bargained for.

episodes.title: No Time Like the Past
episodes.plot: A scientist attempts to use a time machine to prevent tragedies, both in world history and in his own past.

episodes.title: The Parallel
episodes.plot: Astronaut Robert Gaines returns from space to a world that is not exactly the one he left from.

episodes.title: I Dream of Genie
episodes.plot: A wiseacre genie appears from a lamp to a meek man, George P. Hanley. Hanley is so used to bad luck, he imagines how each of three possible wishes could go very wrong - but the genie will grant him only one wish!

episodes.title: The New Exhibit
episodes.plot: A wax-museum employee fights to preserve five figures of famous murderers.

episodes.title: Of Late I Think of Cliffordville
episodes.plot: Aging tycoon William Feathersmith is bored with life and makes arrangements through a devilish travel agency to return to the Cliffordville of his youth and start all over again.

episodes.title: The Incredible World of Horace Ford
episodes.plot: Toymaker Horace Ford is increasingly preoccupied with memories of his childhood, endangering his job and marriage - but a visit to his old neighborhood brings a haunting encounter, suggesting the time was not as idyllic as he remembers.

episodes.title: On Thursday We Leave for Home
episodes.plot: The first human space colony is about to be rescued from the forsaken planet they've been on for three decades. But their leader's having a hard time accepting that change will happen when they get back to Earth.

episodes.title: Passage on the Lady Anne
episodes.plot: A young American couple, the Ransomes, who are trying to salvage their troubled marriage, insist on booking passage on an old trans-Atlantic cruise liner. But other passengers try to persuade them to disembark immediately.

episodes.title: The Bard
episodes.plot: Julius Moomer, a talentless, but relentless, self-promoting hack who dreams of becoming a successful television writer, uses a book of magic to summon William Shakespeare to write dramatic teleplays that Moomer will pass off as his own. Shakespeare becomes irritated by Moomer's lack of appreciation and is even more appalled when he discovers the changes wrought on his plays by cynical television executives.
